summary:
I am an ambitious young professional who is encouraged to grow within the financial sector and as a business developer. Over the last couple of years I’ve developed myself as a business developer within the consultancy branch. Hereby I worked on multiple interdisciplinary projects with a client-based approach.  
Please feel free to reach out on || Koenjpeters@gmail.com  || or send me a message via the chat.

awards:
[{'title': 'Young Professional Programma (YPP)', 'description': 'The Young Professional programme is a development programme for young professionals of Royal HaskoningDHV. The goal is to develop personal and professional skills in communication, advising and project management. The programme consists of the following learning objectives:
•	Personal effectiveness, personal strengths & weaknesses (MBTI)
•	Individual challenges
•	Personal Branding
•	Communication Skills
•	Storytelling techniques
•	Project management
•	Personal effectiveness
•	Personal SWOT in perspective to others
•	Negotiation styles
•	Co-creation with customers
•	Advisory skills
•	Persuasion techniques
•	Acquisitions skills managing internal & external networks
•	Cold acquisition techniques

Next to the above mentioned learning objectives the following courses were followed based on my personal preference:
•	Commercial awareness advanced
•	Communication skills advanced
•	Time management', 'issuer': 'Induna', 'date': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}]

projects:
[{'title': 'Winter evaluation - Schiphol Airport', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'The Netherlands Amsterdam Schiphol Airport uses de-icing fluids on airplanes (glycol) and on the take-off and landing strips. After rainfall, run-off containing de-icing fluids wash into the water system of Schiphol Airport. The high oxygen demand of these substances causes anoxic conditions throughout the entire water system. An elaborate water quality study was performed on the effect the run-off has on oxygen concentrations. On a yearly basis we perform this analyses and advise Schiphol Airport with recommendations.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Koen', 'last_name': 'Peters', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Developer in climate resilience'}]}, {'title': 'Heat stress development plan -  Zandevelt', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': "Within this project we calculated a development plan with regards to heat stress in the neighbourhood Zandevelt. We've used our heat stress model to calculate the current situation and compared this with a future redevelopment plan. The future development plan consists of several climate adaptive measures, such as green infrastructure. This project resulted in before and after maps which showed the heat reduction with regards to the future redevelopment plan. My role in this project was to be project leader, I’ve performed the heat analysis and presenting the results to the municipality.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Koen', 'last_name': 'Peters', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Developer in climate resilience'}]}, {'title': 'Risk dialogue municipality Best', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'The DPRA (Deltaplan Spatial Adaptation) advises Dutch municipalities to complete a climate assessment (stresstest), risk dialogue and implementation agenda within a cycle of 6 years. This project was part of the second phase within the DPRA cycle. Where we facilitated several internal and external workshops with stakeholders, performed a stakeholder analysis and combined this information in an imp[lamentation agenda for the municipality.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Koen', 'last_name': 'Peters', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Developer in climate resilience'}]}, {'title': 'Flood risk assessment Vancouver Airport (YVR)', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'Vancouver International Airport is located on Sea Island at the coast of Vancouver in the Salish Sea area. The airports primary airside assets are sensitive to regular flooding. Water comes from different directions:
•	Sea level / river estuary dealing with water levels outside Sea Island dyke system
•	Precipitation: managing storm water –airport drainage system
•	Groundwater: controlling subsurface water table
A flood risk assessment at the level of a quick scan has been carried out to consider all relevant water management systems in coherence. Short-term measures have been proposed as well as pathways and flood resilience capacities to consider in the long-term.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Koen', 'last_name': 'Peters', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Developer in climate resilience'}]}, {'title': 'Climate assessment in the municipality Best', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'This project was part of the first phase in the climate adaptation trilogy of the Dutch national standards
considering climate adaptation (stresstest, risk dialogue, implementation agenda). We performed a climate assessment to highlight potential risks regarding heat stress, droughts, pluvial
flooding. These themes are all documented in an online report (iReport). My role within this project was to create the heat stress maps and do the interpretation of the maps considering the vulnerability of Best to heat stress. Moreover, I was a facilitator in several sessions within this project where we did an online webinar and an interactive session in Microsoft Teams.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Koen', 'last_name': 'Peters', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Developer in climate resilience'}]}, {'title': 'Climate Adaptation Strategy for the Dutch municipality Midden-Delfland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'This project consists of a climate adaptation strategy for the Dutch municipality: Midden-Delfland. This climate adaptation strategy focused on raising awareness within the municipality with regards to climate change.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Koen', 'last_name': 'Peters', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Developer in climate resilience'}]}, {'title': 'Flood risk analysis at the Waterdunen (NL)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'This project was part of a multidisciplinary study where I performed the flood risk analysis. I have performed a flood risk analysis which consisted of 2 scenarios, an open and a closed scenario. These scenarios were tested on different payback periods to see the potential risk of flooding within the Waterdunen during the different scenarios.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Koen', 'last_name': 'Peters', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Developer in climate resilience'}]}, {'title': 'Geomorphological field work in the French Jura', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'This research consisted of doing a geomorphological fieldwork in the French Jura. Hereby we created a geomorphological map using arcGIS on an iPad with satellite connection in the field. Later on this data was interpreted to create a geomorphological map of the study area and a detailed paleogeographical reconstruction of the area.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Koen', 'last_name': 'Peters', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Developer in climate resilience'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jarmo', 'last_name': 'van der Schaaf', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Coördinator Energie bij de RUD Utrecht | MSc Waterscience and Management | VTH | Sustainability | Energiebesparing'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rik', 'last_name': 'van den Oever', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Jr. Adviseur/onderzoeker Water & Energie bij Deltares'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Hasib', 'last_name': 'Anwar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Project Manager At iwell | MSc Energy Science | BSc Earth Science'}]}, {'title': 'Geological field work in South-East Spain', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': "This project consisted of a geological fieldwork in South-East Spain for three weeks. I've learned here how to create multiple geomorphological and geological maps from fieldwork data. Furthermore, the data was used to create geological profiles and a historical summary of the large scale active geological processes.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Koen', 'last_name': 'Peters', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Developer in climate resilience'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Hasib', 'last_name': 'Anwar', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Project Manager At iwell | MSc Energy Science | BSc Earth Science'}]}]
publications: [{'name': 'Masterthesis: The challenge of heat stress in urban areas', 'publisher': 'Utrecht University', 'url': 'https://dspace.library.uu.nl/handle/1874/381756', 'date': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'authors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Koen', 'last_name': 'Peters', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Developer in climate resilience'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Nanco', 'last_name': 'Dolman', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Lead Expert in Water Resilient Cities | Water Urbanism | Deltares'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marc', 'last_name': 'Bierkens', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Professor of Hydrology at Utrecht University and Vice Dean of Research Faculty of Geosciences'}]}, {'name': 'Bachelorthesis: Extreme temperature events and climate change in the Netherlands', 'publisher': 'VU Amsterdam', 'url': None, 'date': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'authors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Koen', 'last_name': 'Peters', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Developer in climate resilience'}]}]

[{'company': {'id': 2637508, 'name': 'Royal HaskoningDHV', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQEXY5RnsEADnQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1688531529168?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=FNA_1RE27hpxsyOGouSdtzU3tVSLuQovXpIpQop7EgU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/royal-haskoningdhv/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Royal HaskoningDHV', 'description': 'In my role as a business developer I am keen to create new businesses. In short, you will explore business opportunities to grow the business. Hereby I work in close contact with Marketing and Communications (M&C), managers, the tenderdesk and project managers to grow our portfolio. This includes tendering, exploring new leads but also to innovate new digital ways of working. Moreover, it consists of taking the lead in new opportunities, to steer project managers and to implement innovations along the way.', 'title': 'Business Developer', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'company': 'Royal HaskoningDHV', 'description': 'Within my role as a the global tenderdesk manager. I managed a global working tenderdesk team. This team has the responsibility to track leads and support project managers in proposals. We created a new digital way of working, database and structure to position ourselves for upcomings tenders. 

As a manager of this team it was my responsibility to lead the team and to implement innovations.', 'title': 'Global tenderdesk Manager - Climate resilience', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}, {'location': 'Amsterdam en omgeving, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Royal HaskoningDHV', 'description': 'Royal HaskoningDHV (RHDHV) is an independent, international engineering and project management consultancy with 140  years of experience. Within my role as climate consultant we work together with our clients and partners to enhance society by delivering flexible, innovative and sustainable solutions.
